title: 4 Simple Ways to Connect iPad to Car Stereo

steps.title: Ensure your car stereo is compatible.
steps.content: Ensure your car stereo is compatible. You'll need a car stereo that supports Bluetooth devices and audio. Many newer stereos do this, but if you have an older car you may need to install a new stereo first or use one of the other methods in this article. Your car stereo must support the A2DP Bluetooth profile in order to play back music from your iPad. If your stereo has an auxiliary jack but no Bluetooth support, you can use a Bluetooth dongle that connects to the auxiliary jack.

steps.title: Open the Settings app on your iPad.
steps.content: Open the Settings app on your iPad.

steps.title: Tap "Bluetooth" then tap the Bluetooth slider to toggle it on.
steps.content: Tap "Bluetooth" then tap the Bluetooth slider to toggle it on.

steps.title: Open the "Setup" menu on your car stereo.
steps.content: Open the "Setup" menu on your car stereo. This process will vary significantly depending on the stereo brand and car manufacturer.

steps.title: Select the "Phone" option.
steps.content: Select the "Phone" option. Even though you are connecting your iPad, select the "Phone" option.

steps.title: Select "Pair".
steps.content: Select "Pair". This will make the stereo begin searching for your iPad's Bluetooth signal.

steps.title: Select your stereo or car from your iPad's Bluetooth menu.
steps.content: Select your stereo or car from your iPad's Bluetooth menu. It should appear in the list of available devices.

steps.title: Enter the PIN shown in the stereo's display.
steps.content: Enter the PIN shown in the stereo's display. This is usually 0000 .

steps.title: Wait for the connection to be made.
steps.content: Wait for the connection to be made. This may take a few moments. You should see a message on your car stereo informing you that the connection has been made.

steps.title: Start playing music.
steps.content: Start playing music. Now that your iPad is connected, you can start playing music on your car stereo. You will need to switch to the AUX or Bluetooth input.

steps.title: Connect your iPad to your car stereo.
steps.content: Connect your iPad to your car stereo. Connect one end of the cable to the audio jack of the iPad and the other end to the auxiliary port of your stereo head unit.

steps.title: Select the source of audio.
steps.content: Select the source of audio. Press the Source or Mode button on the stereo and select AUX as the source of audio.

steps.title: Launch iTunes.
steps.content: Launch iTunes. Tap the iTunes icon on the iPad, and select any music to play. You should now hear the music playing on you car stereo.

steps.title: Connect the transmitter and iPad.
steps.content: Connect the transmitter and iPad. Use the 3.5 mm cable to connect the transmitter to the audio jack of the iPad. If you live in an urban area, an FM transmitter may be difficult to use due to the crowded airwaves.

steps.title: Insert the FM transmitter power supply to the cigarette adapter inlet.
steps.content: Insert the FM transmitter power supply to the cigarette adapter inlet.

steps.title: Select a radio frequency on your FM transmitter.
steps.content: Select a radio frequency on your FM transmitter.

steps.title: Put the radio on FM mode.
steps.content: Put the radio on FM mode. Tune the radio to the same frequency that you set on the transmitter.

steps.title: Launch iTunes.
steps.content: Launch iTunes. Play any music you want to start playing on the car stereo.

steps.title: Insert the cassette to the tape deck.
steps.content: Insert the cassette to the tape deck. This will be located on the head unit.

steps.title: Connect the 3.
steps.content: Connect the 3. 5 mm audio cable to the iPad's audio jack.

steps.title: Select the source of the audio.
steps.content: Select the source of the audio. On your head unit, press the Source or Mode button and then select Tape.

steps.title: Start playing the tape.
steps.content: Start playing the tape. You may need to press the Play button to begin playing the tape before audio can come out of the speakers.

steps.title: Launch iTunes.
steps.content: Launch iTunes. Select any track to play to start enjoying music in your car.
